abstract.p: Shareholders of Russian oil company Sidanko approve plan that would return assets of oil-producing subsidiary to BP Amoco, Russia's biggest foreign investor; shareholders vote to increase Sidanko's share capital by 37.7 percent, which will give rival oil company, Tyumen Oil, a stake in Sidanko and will allow BP Amoco to retain its 10 percent stake (S)

block.p: Shareholders of the Russian oil company Sidanko approved a plan that would return the assets of an oil-producing subsidiary to BP Amoco, Russia's biggest foreign investor. Shareholders voted to increase Sidanko's share capital by 37.7 percent, which will give a rival oil company, Tyumen Oil, a stake in Sidanko and will allow BP Amoco to retain its 10 percent stake. Last year, Tyumen pushed Sidanko's subsidiary into bankruptcy and bought it at a bargain price over BP Amoco's objections. Under the new agreement, Tyumen will return the assets to Sidanko in exchange for a stake of 25 percent plus one share.
